questionBlock.question: The **1** ________ of London increased rapidly between 1800 and 1850

questionBlock.descriptiveText: The streets were full of horse-drawn vehicles
Charles Pearson, a solicitor, suggested building an underground railway

questionBlock.question: Building the railway would make it possible to move people to better housing in the **2** ________

Negative articles about the project appeared in the **5** ________

questionBlock.descriptiveText: The chosen route did not require many buildings to be pulled down
The 'cut and cover' method was used to construct the tunnels

questionBlock.question: With the completion of the brick arch, the tunnel was covered with **6** ________

templates.introInstruction:
Questions 7-13
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage 1?
templates.formattingInstruction: In boxes 7-13 on your answer sheet, write

questionBlock.question: Other countries had built underground railways before the Metropolitan line opened.
More people than predicted travelled on the Metropolitan line on the first day.
The use of ventilation shafts failed to prevent pollution in the tunnels.
A different approach from the 'cut and cover' technique was required in London's central area.
The windows on City & South London trains were at eye level.
The City & South London Railway was a financial success.
Trains on the 'Tuppenny Tube' nearly always ran on time.
